name: elbow
content:
elbow noun [C]
(BODY PART)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 the part in the middle of the arm where it bends, or the part of a piece of clothing that covers this area: Her arm was bandaged from the elbow to the fingers.at the elbow The sleeve of his shirt was torn at the elbow.
tongwongboot/iStock / Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesI banged my elbow on the shelf.My elbow is still stiff after my fall.

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Parts of clothes
elbow noun [C]
(SPORTS MARK)
in basketball, one of two points on the court (= playing area) where the free throw line meets with another line at a right angle: He set up at the elbow and hit a beautiful shot in the final seconds.

Idioms
at someone's elbow
give someone the elbow
disapproving to push someone rudely with your elbows so that you can move or have more space: elbow your way to He elbowed his way to the front of the crowd. They elbowed the onlookers aside.
to hit someone with your elbow, sometimes as a sign to make them notice or remember something: elbow someone in the ribs She elbowed me in the ribs before I could say anything. The basketball player got elbowed in the face, which was a foul for the other team. He was sent to the penalty box for elbowing another player.

Phrasal verb
elbow someone out
Add to word list
Add to word list
the bony point at which the arm bends, or the part of a piece of clothing which covers this area: His shirt sleeve was torn at the elbow.
to push with an elbow, or to push rudely, esp. to get past someone: He elbowed his way through the crowd.
